tutorial.speak:
Once you've added a section you can add elements to it. Click the Plus icon to add a new element.
Regardless of the element type, simply drag it into a section...
And drop it on any of the green boxes.
You will be prompted to customize the element. For text simply set the alignment...
Enter your text...
And use the editor controls to adjust the appearance.
The element will appear on the page. Double click it to edit. Or drag and drop it to move.
Let's look at some other element types.
"Text with Photo" is a common type for adding an image surrounded by text. Click Select Photo to get started.
You can select from photos you've uploaded before in the gallery...
Upload a new photo...
Or select a stock photo.
Use the search feature to find a relevant photo.
Give your photo a label, set where the photo appears in relation to the text, your text alignment, and enter your text.
Click Save and the page will be updated with your text with photo.
Adding a simple photo is similar. Click Select Photo...
This time note the aspect ratio drop down.
This will allow you to select images that conform to a specific shape. Very useful for ensuring consistency.
Give the photo a label, and if you wish to have it be a link, provide the url and click save.
The image will be inserted, spanning the whole width. See the video on Rows if you do not wish the image to be so wide.
